Posted By: ThisisSakon (6/19/2011 9:09:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I laughed so hard when I read the ultimate. Sure, unattainable, but funny as hell !
  
Also, "brainstorm on a stick" - way to go DonRoyale.
  
   
Besides this, permanent brainstorm could be good enough i guess... But it easier to get rid off him then to dispose of enchantment / artifact, sooo...
  
   
Jace, with his +2 pumping ability, could be a good friend with [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season). Altough, compared to mr. [Markov](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Markov), Jace's +2 ain't that good (I actually wanted to say it sucks, but then I realized how annoying it can be to know your opponent is checking all your incoming cards and decideing for you wich to throw away and wich not... and without you even knowing what he did).

posts.post_content: which card in recent times has risen to $80 in just a few short months? price tag like this goes back to Alpha; during Urza's Saga and its neighboring blocks, cards of recent set would go up to $20 max (even mox diamond). and lands like Gaea's Cradle were $15 a piece. that said, Jace's free brainstorms do justify its mega stardom, but it would be nice if the price gets cut after... a few years, like morphling.

Posted By: MrBarrelRoll (1/31/2011 11:22:04 AM)

posts.post_content:
Got a Jace yesterday during a draft, alongside a Day of Judgement and Luminarch Ascension and well..yeah I won. :p  
  
Jace was able to win me a game single-handedly..he is THAT good..now since I'm the type of person who doesn't buy single cards at all though..I'm fine with just having one for EDH anyway..but for those who do buy cards, this is definately worth the price put on him.  
  
5/5 from me.

Posted By: spicayd (4/6/2010 11:07:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
much better than i originally thought, very annoying, and more importantly, boring, to play against.   
Turn 1:  
 Opponent: " island, pass turn "  
 Me: " , pithing needle, jace the mind sculptor "  
 Opponent: " how'd you know? "  
  
i usually say ALOT of things aren't broken. i've said it about [force of will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=force of will), [tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tarmogoyf), and this. i take back what i said here, this is broken.  
tons of card advantage.  
tons of options.  
very playable casting cost.  
provides various control AND can end the game by itself if left alone. ( albeit getting jaced' is rare )  
  
as a tetanek said on [tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tarmogoyf)'s comments:  
*Ok, I can accept that wizards from time to time makes this kind of overpowered cards, every serious player will have to buy/trade, only because the artwork is as horrible as the format, thus the price is inversely proportional to the originality of the player.*  
  
Wizards, i gotta admit, ya done screwed up here.
posts.html:

Wizards, i gotta admit, ya done screwed up here.

posts.post_content:
Jace made me very angry when week after week when I tried to pick up some worldwake boosters, my local card shops kept telling me that they were out of stock... ... ... I am still angry at his ugly face. I WANT ME SOME WORLDWAKE BOOSTERS!!!   
  
That and the fact that before the ban, everyone I played against at FNM always had a playset of this guy. And there I was with a deck that cost less than a single Jace. (Won a couple matches... But still.)  
  
I don't hate Jace personally... I just hate that he ruined Worldwake for me. -\_-

Posted By: scarecrowk (9/7/2011 3:59:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's capable of giving you [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm), an excellent spell in of itself, each and every single turn in a format where Brainstorm wasn't even printed.
  
   
4 Mana for a permanent that mimics Brainstorm for you each and every single turn is already amazing. However, this guy can also break top-decking, bounces creatures and is capable of..well...outright hosing your opponent's library.
  
   
It *sounds* a little too much, doesn't it?
posts.html:

4 Mana for a permanent that mimics Brainstorm for you each and every single turn is already amazing. However, this guy can also break top-decking, bounces creatures and is capable of..well...outright hosing your opponent's library.

It sounds a little too much, doesn't it?

posts.post_content:
This guy is rated lower than [Jace Beleren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace Beleren), and yet somehow, he is raping standard right now. There was even an article in DailyMTG stating that they didn't mean for him to be this powerful. Why is this at such a low rating? Probably spite and anger, which is understandable, I'm not a fan, either, but that doesn't mean Imma rate it low, Imma rate it high because it is such a good card!  
But those with him, sell him now, he'll probs lose a lot of value once Zendikar rotates out of standard  
  
Edit: BANNED!!!!!! Forget selling him, take him to Extended!
